paper.title: APPLICATION OF MARKOV CHAINS IN FACTORING
paper.abstract: Factoring is a financial transaction whereby a business sells its receivables to a third party (a factor) before their maturity day. In fact, it represents a specific mode of crediting which is mostly preferred by small and medium enterprises. There are several forms of factoring practically used. Differentiation is done depending on scale of property and transfer of risk to the factor. The aim of our paper is to describe theoretical background and practical usage of mathematical model of interest rate estimation (factoring with regression) and risk margin estimation (factoring without regression) by using Markov chains.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用马尔可夫链来估计利率和风险边际，这直接涉及对信用风险和市场风险的评估与管理，属于金融风险管理的范畴。
